question: Which country has become the world's largest arms importer during 2012-16, according to the latest report by Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI)?
explanation:
India has become the world’s largest arms importer during 2012-16, according to the latest report by Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI). As per the report, India accounted for 13% of the total global arms import between 2012–16 which is highest among all the countries. Saudi Arabia, United Arab  Emirates (UAE),  China
and Algeria  are the next four biggest global importers. As per the SIPRI report, the five biggest exporters—the United States, Russia, China, France and Germany—together accounted for 74% of the total volume of arms exports.
